We Need To Talk About Cosby

Interesting and obviously shocking documentary.

Notably, the number and duration of his assaults, the fact that the majority were against white women who never reported him in such racialised times (but revealing the favour for male perpetrators) and, how a significant number of people still choose to separate the good from the depraved.

In some ways, you can't help but think of Saville and his much reported charitable deeds but also his jokes about basically abusing 'children of all ages' and that's what he was doing.

With Cosby, you get similar views into his life which actually propelled positive views for black people, supported equal rights, education and employment but, and it's a huge one, his comedy career was littered with jokes aimed at drugging women for sex. He made albums about drug use and how bad it was for not only adults but one specifically for children too which is beyond creepy.

The lengthy four part documentary is an interesting journey, in which you can see why many black people were so determined to not believe the allegations because he was 'America's Dad', who educated white people into seeing black's as three dimensional people and more than stereotypes. Even when he polarised black people toward the later years with speeches which blamed poor black Americans, he was still held with respect and when finally acquitted over legal mishandling by the prosecution, he still has many black and white people who choose to turn a blind eye because of what he represented in comedy for young whites but more especially betterment for black people

A quick google offers the uncomfortable news that he is saying that 2023 is his year to tour. Oh, my..

Last Episode tonight. 4/4

After spending the early 2000s perched on the high horse of respectability politics, Cosby falls down to Earth. There are two trials, a conviction, incarceration and appeal, and in 2021, an overturned verdict. Now, the debate turns to what is to be done with beloved works of art and the larger systemic problems Cosby’s story lays bare
